claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: `` Sweet Home Alabama '' is a song by Southern rock band Lynyrd Skynyrd that first appeared in 1974 on their second album , Second Helping .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: It reached number 8 on the US chart in 1974 and was the band 's second hit single .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The song was written in reply to `` Southern Man '' and `` Alabama '' by Neil Young ; Young is name-checked in the song 's lyrics .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: James Mangold  (  born December 16 , 1963  )  is an American film and television director , screenwriter and producer .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Films he has directed include Walk the Line , which he also co-wrote ; The Wolverine ; Logan ; Cop Land ; Girl , Interrupted ; Knight and Day ; and the 2007 remake 3:10 to Yuma .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He also produced and directed pilots for the television series Men in Trees  (  which ran from 2006 to 2008  )  NYC 22  (  2011 -- 2012  )  and Vegas  (  2012 -- 2013  )  .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Mangold directed most of the shows , with Weigand acting in the majority of them and Hesson in charge of the plays ' production .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Throughout the chorus of the song , the lyrics contain repeated references of the narrator and his  (  implied  )  girlfriend engaging in underage drinking of whiskey , smoking of unnamed substances  (  implied to be marijuana  )  , and `` making love , '' all in the northern part of Michigan , Kid Rock 's home state , as well as `` singing Sweet Home Alabama all summer long '' .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The song samples two hit songs of the 1970s , Warren Zevon 's `` Werewolves of London '' , and Lynyrd Skynyrd 's `` Sweet Home Alabama '' while the intro sounds similar to Nirvana 's Smells Like Teen Spirit .

claim: James Mangold directed Sweet Home Alabama.
